translations.idiomatic: If you support Han, Han will prevail; if you side with Chu, Chu will win.

sentences.zh: 臣願披腹心，輸肝膽，效愚計，恐足下不能用也。

translations.literal: I wish to bare my innermost heart, offer my liver and gall, present my foolish plan, but fear Your Lordship cannot use it.
translations.idiomatic: I want to lay bare my deepest thoughts, offer you my utter devotion, and present my humble strategy—but I'm afraid you won't be able to use it.

sentences.zh: 誠能聽臣之計，莫若兩利而俱存之，參分天下，鼎足而居，其勢莫敢先動。

translations.literal: If truly able to listen to my minister's plan, nothing better than benefiting both and preserving them together, dividing the world three ways, standing as tripod feet, the situation none dare move first.
translations.idiomatic: If you can truly follow my advice, the best course is to benefit both sides and preserve them, divide the world into three parts, stand firm like a tripod's legs—then neither will dare make the first move.

sentences.zh: 夫以足下之賢聖，有甲兵之眾，據彊齊，從燕、趙，出空虛之地而制其後，因民之欲，西鄉為百姓請命，則天下風走而響應矣，孰敢不聽！

translations.literal: Now with Your Lordship's worthiness and sageliness, having armored troops in multitude, occupying strong Qi, following Yan and Zhao, emerging from empty void lands to control their rear, taking advantage of the people's desires, facing west to petition for the common people, then the world will wind run and echo response. Who dares not listen!
translations.idiomatic: With your wisdom and sagacity, commanding great armies, holding powerful Qi, allied with Yan and Zhao, striking from undefended territory to threaten their rear, following the will of the people, and marching west to champion their cause—then the whole world will flock to your banner like the wind. Who would dare not obey!

sentences.zh: 邦大弱彊，以立諸侯，諸侯已立，天下服聽而歸德於齊。

translations.literal: Support large states weaken strong ones, to establish feudal lords. Feudal lords already established, the world obeys and listens, returning virtue to Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Strengthen the weak states, weaken the strong ones, and establish new feudal lords. Once established, the whole world will submit and attribute virtue to Qi.

sentences.zh: 案齊之故，有膠、泗之地，懷諸侯以德，深拱揖讓，則天下之君王相率而朝於齊矣。

translations.literal: According to Qi's old territories, having Jiao and Si lands, embrace feudal lords with virtue, deeply defer and yield, then the world's rulers will lead each other to court at Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Drawing on Qi's traditional territories including Jiao and Si, embrace the other lords with virtue, practice deep courtesy and deference—then all the world's kings will flock to pay court to Qi.

sentences.zh: 蓋聞天與弗取，反受其咎；

translations.literal: I have heard that Heaven gives but does not take, instead receives its guilt;
translations.idiomatic: As they say, when Heaven offers a gift but you refuse it, you receive blame instead;

sentences.zh: 時至不行，反受其殃。

translations.literal: time arrives but does not act, instead receives its disaster.
translations.idiomatic: when the right moment comes but you don't act, you receive calamity instead.

sentences.zh: 願足下孰慮之。」

translations.literal: I wish Your Lordship carefully consider it.'
translations.idiomatic: Please consider this carefully.'

sentences.zh: 韓信曰：「漢王遇我甚厚，載我以其車，衣我以其衣，食我以其食。

translations.literal: Han Xin said: 'The Han king treats me extremely generously, carries me in his chariot, clothes me with his clothes, feeds me with his food.
translations.idiomatic: Han Xin said: 'The Han king has treated me with extraordinary kindness, sharing his chariot, his clothes, and his food with me.

sentences.zh: 吾聞之，乘人之車者載人之患，衣人之衣者懷人之憂，食人之食者死人之事，吾豈可以鄉利倍義乎！

translations.literal: I have heard that one who rides another's chariot bears another's troubles, one who wears another's clothes harbors another's worries, one who eats another's food dies another's affairs. How can I face profit and betray righteousness!
translations.idiomatic: I've heard that he who rides another's chariot shares their burdens, he who wears another's clothes shares their cares, he who eats another's food serves their causes to the death. How can I chase profit and betray loyalty!

sentences.zh: 」蒯生曰：「足下自以為善漢王，欲建萬世之業，臣竊以為誤矣。

translations.literal: ' Kuai Sheng said: 'Your Lordship considers himself to be serving the Han king well, desiring to establish ten thousand generations' enterprise. I secretly think this is mistaken.
translations.idiomatic: ' Kuai Tong said: 'You think you're serving the Han king loyally and building an eternal legacy. I secretly believe you're making a mistake.

sentences.zh: 始常山王、成安君為布衣時，相與為刎頸之交，後爭張黶、陳澤之事，二人相怨。

translations.literal: Originally King Changshan and Lord Chen'an when they were commoners, mutually formed cut-throat friendship. Later contended over Zhang Qi and Chen Ze matters, the two resented each other.
translations.idiomatic: King Changshan and Lord Chen'an were once sworn brothers when they were commoners, but later fell out over a woman—Zhang Qi—and turned bitterly against each other.

sentences.zh: 常山王背項王，奉項嬰頭而竄，逃歸於漢王。

translations.literal: King Changshan betrayed King Xiang, presented Xiang Ying's head and fled, escaping to return to Han king.
translations.idiomatic: King Changshan betrayed Xiang Yu, presented Xiang Ying's head as proof, and fled to join Liu Bang.

sentences.zh: 漢王借兵而東下，殺成安君泜水之南，頭足異處，卒為天下笑。

translations.literal: Han king borrowed troops and marched east, killed Lord Chen'an south of Chi River, head and feet separated places, finally became the world's laughingstock.
translations.idiomatic: Liu Bang borrowed Han Xin's army to march east, killed Lord Chen'an south of the Chi River, and dismembered him—making himself the laughingstock of the world.

sentences.zh: 此二人相與，天下至驩也。

translations.literal: These two mutually associated, the world utmost happiness.
translations.idiomatic: These two were once the closest of friends in all the world.

sentences.zh: 然而卒相禽者，何也？

translations.literal: Yet finally mutually captured each other, what is it?
translations.idiomatic: Yet in the end they destroyed each other. Why?

sentences.zh: 患生於多欲而人心難測也。

translations.literal: Trouble arises from many desires and human hearts difficult to measure.
translations.idiomatic: Disaster comes from greed and the unpredictability of human nature.

sentences.zh: 今足下欲行忠信以交於漢王，必不能固於二君之相與也，而事多大於張黶、陳澤。

translations.literal: Now Your Lordship desires to practice loyalty and faith to associate with Han king, necessarily cannot be firm like the two lords' mutual association, and matters much greater than Zhang Qi and Chen Ze.
translations.idiomatic: If you try to be loyal and trustworthy with Liu Bang, it won't be as solid as Zhang Er and Chen Yu's friendship was—and the stakes are far higher than a dispute over a woman.

sentences.zh: 故臣以為足下必漢王之不危己，亦誤矣。

translations.literal: Therefore I minister think Your Lordship trusts Han king will not endanger self, also mistaken.
translations.idiomatic: So your confidence that Liu Bang won't threaten you is also a grave mistake.

sentences.zh: 大夫種、范蠡存亡越，霸句踐，立功成名而身死亡。

translations.literal: Grandee Zhong, Fan Li preserved extinguished Yue, hegemon Gou Jian, established merit completed fame yet body died.
translations.idiomatic: Wen Zhong and Fan Li saved the kingdom of Yue from extinction and made Gou Jian hegemon, achieving great fame and success—only to be put to death.

sentences.zh: 野獸已盡而獵狗亨。

translations.literal: Wild beasts already exhausted and hunting dogs cooked.
translations.idiomatic: When the wild game is gone, the hunting dogs are cooked for dinner.

sentences.zh: 夫以交友言之，則不如張耳之與成安君者也；

translations.literal: Now speaking of making friends, then not equal to Zhang Er and Lord Chen'an's relationship;
translations.idiomatic: In terms of friendship, yours with Liu Bang doesn't compare to Zhang Er and Lord Chen'an's bond;

sentences.zh: 以忠信言之，則不過大夫種、范蠡之於句踐也。

translations.literal: speaking of loyalty and faith, then not exceeding Grandee Zhong and Fan Li's to Gou Jian.
translations.idiomatic: in terms of loyalty and trustworthiness, yours doesn't surpass Wen Zhong and Fan Li's service to Gou Jian.

sentences.zh: 此二人者，足以觀矣。

translations.literal: These two pairs, sufficient to observe.
translations.idiomatic: These examples should be enough to teach you the lesson.

sentences.zh: 願足下深慮之。

translations.literal: I wish Your Lordship deeply consider it.
translations.idiomatic: Please consider this very carefully.

sentences.zh: 且臣聞勇略震主者身危，而功蓋天下者不賞。

translations.literal: Moreover I minister heard courageous strategy startling lord ones body endangered, and merit covering world ones not rewarded.
translations.idiomatic: I've also heard that those whose courage and strategy intimidate their ruler endanger themselves, while those whose achievements eclipse the world go unrewarded.

sentences.zh: 臣請言大王功略：足下涉西河，虜魏王，禽夏說，引兵下井陘，誅成安君，徇趙，脅燕，定齊，南摧楚人之兵二十萬，東殺龍且，西鄉以報，此所謂功無二於天下，而略不世出者也。

translations.literal: I minister request to speak Your Majesty merit strategy: Your Lordship crossed west river, captured Wei king, took Xia Yue prisoner, led troops down Jingxing, executed Lord Chen'an, conquered Zhao, intimidated Yan, pacified Qi, south crushed Chu people's troops two hundred thousand, east killed Long Ju, west faced to repay, this called merit without second in world, and strategy not emerging in generations.
translations.idiomatic: Let me recount Your Majesty's achievements and strategic brilliance: You crossed the Yellow River west, captured the king of Wei, took Xia Yue prisoner, led your troops through Jingxing Pass, executed Lord Chen'an, conquered Zhao, intimidated Yan, pacified Qi, crushed two hundred thousand Chu troops to the south, killed Long Ju to the east, and faced west to repay your debts. This is merit unmatched in the world, strategy that appears once in a thousand years.

sentences.zh: 今足下戴震主之威，挾不賞之功，歸楚，楚人不信；

translations.literal: Now Your Lordship wears awe-inspiring lord power, carries unrewarded merit, return to Chu, Chu people not believe;
translations.idiomatic: Now you bear power that intimidates rulers, carry achievements that go unrewarded. If you go to Chu, they won't trust you;

sentences.zh: 歸漢，漢人震恐：足下欲持是安歸乎？

translations.literal: return to Han, Han people tremble in fear: Your Lordship wishes to hold this where safely return?
translations.idiomatic: if you go to Han, they'll be terrified. Where do you intend to take this power and find safety?

sentences.zh: 夫勢在人臣之位而有震主之威，名高天下，竊為足下危之。

translations.literal: Now position in minister's place yet has awe-inspiring lord power, fame high in world, secretly for Your Lordship fear it.
translations.idiomatic: Your position as a minister gives you power that intimidates rulers, and your fame eclipses all others. I secretly fear for your safety.

sentences.zh: 」韓信謝曰：「先生且休矣，吾將念之。」

translations.literal: ' Han Xin thanked saying: 'Master for now rest, I will think about it.'
translations.idiomatic: ' Han Xin replied politely: 'Master, please stop for now. I will consider your words.'

sentences.zh: 後數日，蒯通復說曰：「夫聽者事之候也，計者事之機也，聽過計失而能久安者，鮮矣。

translations.literal: Later several days, Kuai Tong again persuaded saying: 'Now listening is affairs' waiting, planning is affairs' mechanism, listen wrongly plan wrongly and able long-term peace ones, few.
translations.idiomatic: A few days later, Kuai Tong tried again: 'Listening is the sentinel of affairs, planning is their mechanism. Those who mishear and misplan yet achieve lasting security are few indeed.

sentences.zh: 聽不失一二者，不可亂以言；

translations.literal: listen not missing one two ones, cannot be confused with words;
translations.idiomatic: Those who never err in what they hear cannot be confused by mere words;

sentences.zh: 計不失本末者，不可紛以辭。

translations.literal: plan not missing root branch ones, cannot be confused with arguments.
translations.idiomatic: those who never err in their plans cannot be distracted by clever arguments.

sentences.zh: 夫隨廝養之役者，失萬乘之權；

translations.literal: Now follow servant groom service ones, lose ten thousand chariot power;
translations.idiomatic: Those who serve as grooms and servants lose control of imperial power;

sentences.zh: 守儋石之祿者，闕卿相之位。

translations.literal: guard basket stone salary ones, miss prime minister position.
translations.idiomatic: those who cling to meager salaries miss the office of prime minister.

sentences.zh: 故知者決之斷也，疑者事之害也，審豪氂之小計，遺天下之大數，智誠知之，決弗敢行者，百事之禍也。

translations.literal: Therefore wise ones decisive break, doubting ones affairs' harm, carefully examine downy hair small plans, abandon world's great principles, intelligence truly knows it, decisive yet dares not act ones, hundred affairs' disaster.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore the wise are decisive, the doubtful bring harm to affairs. Those who scrutinize tiny details miss the great patterns of the world. Even if you truly understand, but hesitate to act decisively—that brings disaster to all endeavors.

sentences.zh: 故曰『猛虎之猶豫，不若蜂蠆之致螫；

translations.literal: Therefore said 'fierce tiger's hesitation, not equal bee scorpion's determined sting;
translations.idiomatic: As they say, 'A hesitant tiger is no match for a scorpion's determined strike;

sentences.zh: 騏驥之跼躅，不如駑馬之安步；

translations.literal: thoroughbred's hesitation, not equal nag's steady pace;
translations.idiomatic: a thoroughbred that hesitates is no match for a nag that walks steadily;

sentences.zh: 孟賁之狐疑，不如庸夫之必至也；

translations.literal: Meng Ben's doubt, not equal common man's certain arrival;
translations.idiomatic: Meng Ben's doubts are no match for a commoner's determination;

sentences.zh: 雖有舜禹之智，吟而不言，不如瘖聾之指麾也』。

translations.literal: though has Shun Yu wisdom, chant but not speak, not equal mute deaf gesture.'
translations.idiomatic: even wisdom like Shun or Yu, if you chant but don't act, is no match for a mute gesturing.'

sentences.zh: 此言貴能行之。

translations.literal: This speech precious can act on it.
translations.idiomatic: The value of these words lies in putting them into action.

sentences.zh: 夫功者難成而易敗，時者難得而易失也。

translations.literal: Now merit ones difficult to complete yet easy to destroy, opportunity ones difficult to obtain yet easy to lose.
translations.idiomatic: Achievement is hard to build but easy to ruin; opportunity is hard to seize but easy to let slip.

sentences.zh: 時乎時，不再來。

translations.literal: Opportunity ah opportunity, not again come.
translations.idiomatic: Opportunity comes but once.

sentences.zh: 願足下詳察之。

translations.literal: I wish Your Lordship detailed examine it.
translations.idiomatic: Please examine this carefully.

sentences.zh: 」韓信猶豫不忍倍漢，又自以為功多，漢終不奪我齊，遂謝蒯通。

translations.literal: ' Han Xin hesitated not bearing to betray Han, moreover self considered merit many, Han finally not seize my Qi, then declined Kuai Tong.
translations.idiomatic: ' Han Xin hesitated and could not bear to betray Liu Bang. Moreover, he considered his achievements so great that Liu Bang would never take Qi from him. So he declined Kuai Tong's advice.

sentences.zh: 蒯通說不聽，已詳狂為巫。

translations.literal: Kuai Tong persuasion not listened to, already feigned madness became shaman.
translations.idiomatic: Kuai Tong's advice was not heeded, so he feigned madness and became a shaman.

sentences.zh: 漢王之困固陵，用張良計，召齊王信，遂將兵會垓下。

translations.literal: Han king trapped at Guliu, used Zhang Liang plan, summoned Qi king Xin, then led troops joined at Gaixia.
translations.idiomatic: Liu Bang was trapped at Guliu. Using Zhang Liang's plan, he summoned King Xin of Qi, who then led his troops to join the forces at Gaixia.

sentences.zh: 項羽已破，高祖襲奪齊王軍。

translations.literal: Xiang Yu already broken, Gaozu suddenly seized Qi king army.
translations.idiomatic: Once Xiang Yu was defeated, Gaozu suddenly seized the Qi king's army.

sentences.zh: 漢五年正月，徙齊王信為楚王，都下邳。

translations.literal: Han fifth year first month, moved Qi king Xin to be Chu king, capital Xiapi.
